page.title: 15Communications,Kinbrace
page.content: Communications are very important in a remote community. Most people have telephones and all but one family have television. There is a mast on the hill which beams signals to the houses. This was erected by the local people. C.B. radio is used widely for work and local news. The water bailiffs have special radios which only they can talk on. Cars are very important when you live in the middle of nowhere and everybody has a car. There is a daily mail bus running between Kinbrace and Bettyhill on the north coast which conveys passengers to and from Kinbrace Station and a bus service once a week from the village of Helmsdale. The radio is very important when we have snowstorms and at that time Moray Firth Radio is a vital link with the outside world.
